intro: Austrostipa scabra subsp. scabra, commonly known as the scabrous wiregrass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Australia. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has wiry, slender stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and covered with fine, bristly hairs, giving it a scabrous appearance. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as plains, dunes, and rocky outcrops.
